lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/ghbot.GhBot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run ghbot.GhBot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
Hi! **GhBot** is an efficient chat bot that remembers your tasks for you!
# Refer below for the details of each instruction
There are three different ways you can add a task.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
> The start time(from) should be earlier than the end time(to).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
This instruction will list all the task created by the user.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Here are the list of tasks that matches with your description
> GhBot will exit after 1.5 seconds to show goodbye message!
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* This is the main class for the chatbot.
* @param filename The name of the file.
* Returns the response with respect to the user input.
* @param input A string containing the user input.
* @return A string containing the respective response of the given input.
* Returns a goodbye message to user.
* @return A string containing a goodbye message.
this.executeStr = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* @param description A description of the deadline.
* @param deadlineTime The time of the deadline.
* Returns a string to let user know that they have successfully added a deadline task.
* @return A string to let user know that they have successfully added a deadline task.
this.executeStr = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + deadline + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* @param listNo The index of the task that is going to be removed.
* Returns a string to let user know that the task has been removed.
* @return A string to let user know that the task has been removed.
return "Sorry, you may have select a task that is out of scope!\n"
+ "Please select a number from 1 to " + taskList.taskSize();
this.executeStr = "Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + taskList.getTask(this.listNo - 1) + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* @param description A description of the event.
* @param fromTime The start time of the event.
* @param toTime The end time of the event.
public EventExecutor(String description, String fromTime, String toTime) {
* Returns a string to let user know that the event has been added.
* @return A string to let user know that the event has been added.
Event event = new Event(this.description, this.fromTime, this.toTime);
this.executeStr = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + event + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* Sets an instance of task list.
* Returns a string containing the output of the respective instruction.
* @return A string containing the output of the respective instruction.
* @param description A description of the word the user is finding.
* Returns all the tasks that matches the description.
* @return A string containing all the tasks that matches the description.
this.executeStr = "Here are the list of tasks that matches with your description:";
* @return A string containing all the saved tasks.
this.executeStr = "Here are the tasks in your list:";
* @param listNo The index of the task to mark.
* Returns a string to let user know that the selected task is marked.
* @return A string to let user know that the selected task is marked.
this.executeStr = "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n" + taskList.getTask(i);
return "Sorry, you may have select a task that is out of scope!\n"
+ "Please select a number from 1 to " + taskList.taskSize();
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Returns a string to let user know that the todo task has been added.
* @return A string to let user know that the todo task has been added.
this.executeStr = "Got it. I've added this task:\n" + todo + "\n";
this.executeStr = this.executeStr + "Now you have " + taskList.taskSize() + " tasks in the list.";
* @param listNo The index of the task to unmark.
* Returns a string to let user know that the task has been unmarked.
* @return A string to let user know that the task has been unmarked.
this.executeStr = "OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n" + taskList.getTask(i);
return "Sorry, you may have select a task that is out of scope!\n"
+ "Please select a number from 1 to " + taskList.taskSize();
